name: Forge Automation
headline: CNC parts in 4 days or less
description: Forge Automation runs software enabled factories that deliver custom metal parts in four days or less. Instead of mechanical engineers having to wait two to three weeks for their low volume CNC parts, they can simply upload a CAD model on our platform and we will ship it out in four days or less. We aim to give mechanical engineers the "Amazon experience" for custom metal parts.

founders.name: Walter Raftus, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder + CTO @ Forge Automation |  I love computers, math, and big specialized machines controlled with software!

I went to the University of Waterloo for AI + Mechatronics Engineering, and interned at Nvidia, Trexo Robotics (W19), and Intel PSG working on a bunch of different software ranging from system software, deep learning, and embedded control. I graduated in the summer of 2022 and co-founded Forge Automation right after!

founders.name: Timothy Seto, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder + CEO @ Forge Automation | I make metal parts. Send me CAD, I will make it in the real world.

I went to the University of Waterloo Engineering, and interned at Apple, Formlabs and iRobot. I have been machining for over 10 years and I love building robots and machines. I graduated in the summer of 2022 and co-founded Forge Automation right after.

![Background](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/hero.png)
# CNC Parts in as fast as 1 day
Forge Automation makes your CNC parts FAST
  * Standard orders made within 4 days
  * Free 1-2 day shipping
  * Instant Pricing


[Upload a Part](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
Our platform works best on desktop.
Enter your email and we will forward you a link to try the site out on the computer!
Send
Trusted by engineers building
Industr|
[![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/company/lumafield.svg)](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/<https:/www.lumafield.com/>)[![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/company/revolve.svg)](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/<https:/www.revolvesurgical.com/>)[![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/company/sendcutsend.svg)](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/<https:/www.sendcutsend.com/>)
CNC Machining Made Easy
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/step.png)
Upload Step Files
Configure your part's material, tolerances, and threads
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/cart.png)
Get a quote & checkout
Recieve an instant quote with adjustable leadtime
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/machine.png)
We make your parts
We begin making your part the day its ordered
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/package.png)
Parts are shipped
Expect your parts to arrive in 1-2 days once shipped
[Get Started](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
### Capabilities
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/capabilities.JPG)
We manufacture all your parts in Canada using our fleet of 3 axis CNC mills!We currently offer only CNC milling services.
Min part size:0.125" x 0.125" x 0.125"Max part size:24" x 12" x 4"
[Upload a Part](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/capabilities.JPG)
### Materials
We always keep material on hand so we can start on your order right away!Don't see what you need? Email us and we can try to source it for you!
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/aluminum-alloys.png)
Aluminum Alloys
6061
In-Stock Options:6061 Aluminum
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/stainless-steel.png)
Stainless Steels
303, 304
In-Stock Options:SUS 303SOS 304
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/plastics.png)
Plastics
Acetal, Acrylic
In-Stock Options:Acetal (White/Black)ABS (Natural/Black)
[Browse Materials](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/finishes.png)
### Finishes
Add finishes to make parts to make them look and feel perfect!
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/finishes.png)
Our finishing options are done in the same or next day using our in-house tools and vetted suppliers to keep lead times lightning fast.
[Explore Finishes](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
### Tolerances
Our default shop tolerance on all features is ±0.005". We can achieve tolerances down to ±0.001" if needed.
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/tolerances.png)
You can specify tolerances by uploading a 2D drawing or annotating your 3D model.
[Submit a Part](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/about-assets/tolerances.png)
### Ready to get started?
[Upload a Design](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/</submit>)
![](https://www.forgeautomation.ca/docs-assets/logos/footer-logo.svg)
### Forge Automation
©2025 by Forge Automation Corp.

generated_description:
**Forge Automation: Revolutionizing CNC Machining**

Founded in 2022 and based in Toronto, Canada, Forge Automation is on a mission to redefine the custom metal parts industry by delivering CNC parts in an astonishing four days or less. With a team of seven, the company emerged from Y Combinator's W25 batch, gaining traction in the competitive landscape of hardware, robotics, and manufacturing.

Imagine being a mechanical engineer who needs low-volume CNC parts—traditionally, you'd expect to wait two to three weeks. Forge Automation flips that expectation on its head. Their platform allows users to upload a CAD model, and just like that, with a few clicks, engineers can enjoy the "Amazon experience" of fast and reliable CNC parts delivery.

Here's how it works:
1. **Upload Your Part:** Users can easily upload their design files directly onto Forge's user-friendly platform.
2. **Instant Pricing:** Once a design is uploaded, users receive instant quotes, with options to adjust lead times based on their needs.
3. **Rapid Production:** Parts are manufactured the moment they're ordered, ensuring quick turnaround times.
4. **Quick Shipping:** Expect free shipping to get your parts delivered within 1-2 days after production.

Forge's capabilities are focused on CNC milling, utilizing a fleet of 3-axis CNC mills located in Canada. They have a minimum part size of 0.125" cubed and can accommodate parts up to 24" x 12" x 4". Their material offerings include various aluminum alloys, stainless steels, and plastics, with stock always on hand to expedite the order process. 

Moreover, Forge emphasizes precise tolerances, maintaining a default tolerance of ±0.005" but can achieve tighter specifications down to ±0.001". They also provide finishing options, which can be completed quickly leveraging in-house tools and trusted suppliers.

Being part of Y Combinator and having the guidance of Michael Seibel as their group partner adds a level of credibility and network strength to their operations, positioning Forge Automation as a forward-thinking player ready to challenge industry norms.

For more information, insights, and to start ordering your parts, visit [Forge Automation](https://www.forgeautomation.ca). 

In a nutshell, Forge Automation is a game-changer for engineers who need speed and efficiency—changing the centuries-old paradigm of manufacturing into something that fits the pace of today's market.
